close_symbols: memset (declaration / possible macro in project headers, normally from <string.h>)
explanation: Only memset from <string.h> is used in the target function, so to check MISRA's rule about string.h routines writing beyond object bounds you must verify (1) the exact type and size of the object being written (ts_end) and (2) the semantics/signature of memset being invoked. "struct timespec" is required so you can determine sizeof(ts_end) (members, member types, padding, and whether any non‑standard or flexible array members exist) and thereby confirm that the byte count passed to memset (sizeof(ts_end)) does not exceed the actual object size. "memset" is required to ensure the project has the standard byte-based semantics (prototype void *memset(void *, int, size_t)) and that it has not been redefined/macroed in the codebase with different semantics that could cause out‑of‑bounds writes.
